channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Artist cancels her exhibition after Smithsonian wants to remove a portrait
item.description: Artist Amy Sherald, who painted Michelle Obama's portrait, has canceled an upcoming exhibition of her work at the Smithsonian's National Portrait Gallery after a dispute.

item.title: What's needed to help historic starvation levels in Gaza is 'tragically simple,' aid group says
item.description: Starvation is plaguing Gaza. We hear about why getting food to the half million people who need it is so difficult.

item.title: British jazz, pop and classical singer Cleo Laine dies at 97
item.description: An appreciation of Dame Cleo Laine, a jazz singer whose evocative phrasing and four-octave range made her among the most celebrated voices in the world.

item.title: France recognizes Palestinian state
item.description: President Emmanuel Macron says France will become the first G7 country to recognize a Palestinian state, drawing praise from Palestinian leaders and sharp condemnation from Israel. Will other nations follow?

item.title: Corporate America's weird tariffs summer
item.description: Tariffs chaos is continuing â€” but investors and some big companies are shrugging it off.

item.title: As Trump heads to one of his golf resorts in Scotland, protesters are waiting
item.description: Protesters gather in Scotland, where President Trump's late mother was born, and where he's dedicating a new golf resort to her this weekend.

item.title: A Democratic Senator was already investigating Jeffrey Epstein's finances
item.description: NPR's Ari Shapiro speaks with Sen. Ron Wyden, D-Ore., about his office's investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's financial transactions -- and why he is urging the U.S. attorney general to act further.

item.title: The implications of the Trump administration's aggressive new vaccine policies
item.description: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has been making big changes to federal vaccine policies. Many medical experts are concerned the administration will further limit vaccine access.

item.title: Democrats push for immigration enforcement officers to unmask
item.description: Democrats have introduced legislation in California and New York, as well as in Congress, requiring officers to show their faces as anger mounts about the "secret police" vibe of ICE officers.

item.title: Poker players call foul on Trump's tax and spending law
item.description: A new law could mean bettors lose more money during tax season. Major poker players are calling on Congress to royally flush the measure down the drain.
